intro: Alsine debilis, commonly known as the slender alsike, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and often have a bluish-green hue. It produces small, pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. This plant thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides.
